definition: to work part time while studying/work-study program

sentences.english: This paper discusses on the special significance of the work-study programme on libraries" development."
sentences.chinese: 重点论述了勤工俭学对图书馆发展的特殊意义。

sentences.english: He planned to work his way through college.
sentences.chinese: 他打算靠勤工俭学读完大学。

sentences.english: Now you know what workstudy means?
sentences.chinese: 现在你知道什么叫勤工俭学了吧？

sentences.english: Of course, I also will do some part-time jobs through working during the proper time.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我会考虑在适当的时候从事勤工俭学的工作。

definition: to deny oneself comforts in order to save money for one's education
to drop out of school/to leave off studying/to interrupt one's studies
(of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study
to go to school/to attend school
excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school)/a paragon of virtue and learning
to join the faculty of one's alma mater upon graduation/to remain at school during vacation
lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living
